intro: Elytranthe decussata, commonly known as the decussate ellytrant, is a perennial herb native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and lance-shaped leaves that are often arranged in a crosswise pattern. Its small, clustered flowers are typically greenish-white in color and bloom during the spring and summer months. Elytranthe decussata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
